scoring_rule: Each problem: ALL words must be correct. Level: 80% of problems must pass.

problems.prompt:
# Syllable Puzzle

Find 8 words using the syllables from the bank.
Each syllable is used exactly once (extras are distractors).

## Syllable Bank
rone, body, un, kha, der, de, ni, ing, look, over, com, sound, ki, owen, sists, mead, vibes, man, able, ty

## Clues
A. (3 syllables) — Structure hint: (prefix: co-, suffix: -er) — The chief officer of a commandry.
B. (4 syllables) — Structure hint: (prefix: un-, suffix: -able) — Irrefutable, or impossible to deny.
C. (1 syllables) — A drink composed of syrup of sarsaparilla or other flavouring extract, and water, and sometimes charged with carbon dioxide.
D. (2 syllables) — A British person.
E. (1 syllables) — free from moral defect
F. (3 syllables) — Structure hint: (prefix: over-, suffix: -ing) — watch over
G. (1 syllables) — invest with or as with a [masked]; give [masked] to
H. (2 syllables) — A black man who is successful with women and dating. Yourtango, [https://www.yourtango.com/2018312914/what-does-chad-mean-incel-slang-definitions-history-terms-on-forums-reddit-4chan "What Does 'Chad' Mean? The Odd Way Incel Men On Reddit And 4Chan Use It To Describe Certain Guys"], Arianna Jeret, 5 August 2019 Hornet Networks, [https://hornet.com/stories/what-are-incels-incel-movement-two/ "A Quick Explainer of the Incel Movement, the Saddest Bunch of Hateful Dorks on the Internet"], Matt Keeley, 25 April 2018

## Answer Format
Return JSON: {"answers": ["WORD1", "WORD2", ...]}
Words must be UPPERCASE and in clue order.

# Syllable Puzzle

Find 9 words using the syllables from the bank.
Each syllable is used exactly once (extras are distractors).

## Syllable Bank
clude, in, fan, grates, ble, tem, jean, per, port, cied, te, tune, for, si, ate, maths, in, lio, im, pos, fo

## Clues
A. (2 syllables) — SYN: admit
B. (3 syllables) — SYN: moderate
C. (3 syllables) — SYN: desegregate
D. (3 syllables) — The post and the responsibilities of a cabinet minister or other head of a government department.
E. (2 syllables) — SYN: envision
F. (2 syllables) — SYN: chance
G. (4 syllables) — SYN: inconceivable
H. (1 syllables) — SYN: math
I. (1 syllables) — SYN: denim

## Answer Format
Return JSON: {"answers": ["WORD1", "WORD2", ...]}
Words must be UPPERCASE and in clue order.

# Syllable Puzzle

Find 9 words using the syllables from the bank.
Each syllable is used exactly once (extras are distractors).

## Syllable Bank
dieval, per, slow, lob, ster, gists, con, spon, ders, nier, cur, ing, skies, ly, front, smeared, xi, fun, re, ol, se, bi, willard, form, o, me

## Clues
A. (2 syllables) — Relation hint: Topic domain: noun.food — A soldier or officer of the imperial British Army (due to their red or scarlet uniform).
B. (4 syllables) — Relation hint: Synonym: biologist — (biology) a scientist who studies living organisms
C. (3 syllables) — Relation hint: Example usage: He procured extra cigarettes even though they were rationed — furnish with battens
D. (2 syllables) — Relation hint: Synonym: do — [masked] a function
E. (2 syllables) — Relation hint: Contains double 'n' — beyond or deviating from the usual or expected
F. (2 syllables) — Relation hint: Has suffix '-ly' — without speed (`slow' is sometimes used informally for `[masked]')
G. (2 syllables) — Relation hint: Example usage: chivalric rites — relating to or belonging to the Middle Ages
H. (3 syllables) — Relation hint: Synonym: answerer — someone who responds
I. (2 syllables) — Relation hint: Opposite of: avoid — To engage in [masked]ation.

## Answer Format
Return JSON: {"answers": ["WORD1", "WORD2", ...]}
Words must be UPPERCASE and in clue order.

# Syllable Puzzle

Find 10 words using the syllables from the bank.
Each syllable is used exactly once (extras are distractors).

## Syllable Bank
mums, psy, ac, chosis, van, lat, ful, ver, jerks, cept, edge, versed, ed, able, mu, cou, weighed, mouth, helpers, cu, ac, air, knowl, borne, palace

## Clues
A. (2 syllables) — Awareness of a particular fact or situation; a state of having been informed or made aware of something.
B. (2 syllables) — Fitted to an aircraft.
C. (1 syllables) — move with abrupt, seemingly uncontrolled motions
D. (5 syllables) — collect or gather
E. (1 syllables) — thoroughly acquainted through study or experience; -W.H.Hudson; - Herbert Read
F. (3 syllables) — English navigator remembered for his exploration of the Pacific coast of North America (1757-1798)
G. (2 syllables) — A severe mental disorder, sometimes with physical damage to the brain, marked by a deranged personality and a distorted view of reality.
H. (1 syllables) — a person who contributes to the fulfillment of a need or furtherance of an effort or purpose
I. (3 syllables) — meeting requirements
J. (2 syllables) — Quite a bit.

## Answer Format
Return JSON: {"answers": ["WORD1", "WORD2", ...]}
Words must be UPPERCASE and in clue order.
